parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to fetch.

operations.notes: fetches all existing tasks on the server; optionally just the one specified by id
operations.summary: Fetch all tasks or one task with id
operations.examples:
Getting all tasks:

shell> curl --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

[ 
  { 
    "id" : "48250492", 
    "name" : "user-defined task", 
    "type" : "periodic", 
    "period" : 1, 
    "created" : 1419018721.533763, 
    "command" : "(function () {\n      require('org/arangodb/foxx/queues/manager').manage();\n    })(params)", 
    "database" : "_system" 
  }, 
  { 
    "id" : "statistics-collector", 
    "name" : "statistics-collector", 
    "type" : "periodic", 
    "period" : 10, 
    "created" : 1419018720.368606, 
    "command" : "require('org/arangodb/statistics').historian();", 
    "database" : "_system" 
  }, 
  { 
    "id" : "statistics-average-collector", 
    "name" : "statistics-average-collector", 
    "type" : "periodic", 
    "period" : 900, 
    "created" : 1419018720.368689, 
    "command" : "require('org/arangodb/statistics').historianAverage();", 
    "database" : "_system" 
  }, 
  { 
    "id" : "statistics-gc", 
    "name" : "statistics-gc", 
    "type" : "periodic", 
    "period" : 450, 
    "created" : 1419018720.369173, 
    "command" : "require('org/arangodb/statistics').garbageCollector();", 
    "database" : "_system" 
  } 
]



Getting a single task by id:

shell> curl --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks/statistics-average-collector

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "id" : "statistics-average-collector", 
  "name" : "statistics-average-collector", 
  "type" : "periodic", 
  "period" : 900, 
  "created" : 1419018720.368689, 
  "command" : "require('org/arangodb/statistics').historianAverage();", 
  "database" : "_system", 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}



Fetching a non-existing task:

shell> curl --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks/non-existing-task

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "code" : 404, 
  "errorNum" : 1852, 
  "errorMessage" : "task not found" 
}

errorResponses.reason: If the post body is not accurate, a HTTP 400 is returned.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
A JSON object describing the new task:

  • name: name of the task
  • command: JavaScript code to be executed
  • params: parameters to be passed into command
  • period: n seconds between the executions
  • offset: n seconds initial delay

operations.notes: creates a new task with a generated id
operations.examples:
shell> curl -X POST --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks/
{"name":"SampleTask","command":"(function(params) { require('internal').print(params); })(params)","params":{"foo":"bar","bar":"foo"},"period":2}

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "id" : "1519599228", 
  "name" : "SampleTask", 
  "type" : "periodic", 
  "period" : 2, 
  "created" : 1419018764.274129, 
  "command" : "(function(params) { require('internal').print(params); })(params)", 
  "database" : "_system", 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}
shell> curl -X DELETE --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks/1519599228

errorResponses.reason: If the task id already exists or the rest body is not accurate, HTTP 400 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to create

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
A JSON object describing the new task:

  • name: name of the task
  • command: javascript code to be executed
  • params: parameters to be passed into command
  • period: n seconds between the executions
  • offset: n seconds initial delay

operations.notes: registers a new task with the specified id
operations.examples:
shell> curl -X PUT --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks/sampleTask
{"id":"SampleTask","name":"SampleTask","command":"(function(params) { require('internal').print(params); })(params)","params":{"foo":"bar","bar":"foo"},"period":2}

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "id" : "sampleTask", 
  "name" : "SampleTask", 
  "type" : "periodic", 
  "period" : 2, 
  "created" : 1419018764.285129, 
  "command" : "(function(params) { require('internal').print(params); })(params)", 
  "database" : "_system", 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}

errorResponses.reason: If the task id is unknown, then an HTTP 404 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the task to delete.

operations.notes: Deletes the task identified by id on the server.
operations.examples:
shell> curl -X DELETE --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks/NoTaskWithThatName

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "code" : 404, 
  "errorNum" : 1852, 
  "errorMessage" : "task not found" 
}






shell> curl -X DELETE --data-binary @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/tasks/SampleTask

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "code" : 200 
}
